image.altText: An illustration of Islamic State iconography superimposed over a browser window containing an image of Rick Astley.

items.synopsis: Defeating Islamic State militants required disabling their significant cyber capabilities — and pop star Rick Astley unwittingly played a hand in doing so.

title.children: In the heat of battle, IS militants' phones were hijacked thanks to Australians inspired by Rick Astley

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann speaks to 7NEWS Spotlight in an interview.

items.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann says he may still sue Brittany Higgins personally for defamation, in his first television interview since she accused him of raping her at Parliament House in 2019.

title.children: '50pc of the country thinks I'm a rapist': Bruce Lehrmann says he may sue Brittany Higgins over allegation he denies

image.altText: A person's blurred shoulder as they walk past a PWC logo.

items.synopsis: Consulting giant PwC is embroiled in a scandal of its own doing, having used confidential government information to benefit its bottom line. Here's how it happened, and what consequences the firm is facing.

title.children: The PwC scandal is a 'shocking breach of trust' that's left the government 'furious'. Here's why

image.altText: Nine teenagers wearing matching blue jeans and white tshirt and sneakers pose for a photo in front of their school building

items.synopsis: Despite their school being struck by a missile, those who remain of the class of 2023 in Kharkiv aren't letting a war rob them of their graduation celebrations.

title.children: The Kharkiv class of 2023 may be few in number, but it holds big hopes for the future

image.altText: An aerial view of coal extracted from the Narrabri mine, with a landscape of lakes and mountains behind it.

items.synopsis: An ABC analysis uncovers several examples of project approval being granted to coalmines based on environmental assessments that contained significant underestimates of their greenhouse gas pollution.

title.children: This coalmine is polluting three times as much as expected. And that's not unusual

image.altText: Two firefighters use a hose on a house that has been destroyed by fire

items.synopsis: Emergency services responded to reports that three people had been assaulted at a house that was then destroyed by fire in the early hours of Sunday morning.

title.children: Man arrested after alleged assaults, house fire on Fleurieu Peninsula

image.altText: Jamie and Mick at a table, both have one hand on braille protoype, both smiling.

items.synopsis: Mick and Jamie have been mates for almost three decades and have worked on a project with one goal in mind — to ensure everyone can use a computer.

title.children: Mick and Jamie created software that could have made them rich. This is why they don't want a cent

image.altText: A woman holds a sign which reads 'arrest me pete'

items.synopsis: Support from the opposition, opposition from allies, "Arrest Me Pete" t-shirts, Bob Marley lyrics in parliament and descriptions of the bill as a "faecal sandwich" — the SA government's crackdown on "obstructionist protesters" incited a robust response, writes Rory McClaren.

title.children: A 'faecal sandwich' or a vital public safety measure? Why SA's new laws have proved so contentious

image.altText: Jenny Odell, with shoulder-length black hair and black shirt, sits before blurred greenery behind her, smiling widely.

items.synopsis: Hyper-efficiency, or squeezing the most from every moment of the day, won't make time seem more expansive, argues author Jenny Odell. Here's what she says will.

title.children: Waking at 4am to exercise, 'crushing' your day and other habits that may be making you less happy

image.altText: Miyu Kato

items.synopsis: A doubles team is sent packing from the French Open after a controversial disqualification, while Novak Djokovic breaks a Rafael Nadal record.

title.children: 'Crying for like 15 minutes': Doubles team bounced from French Open after ball kid hit

image.altText: Aunty McRose Elu standing infront of tropical greenery with a bright shirt on wearing glasses and looking serious

items.synopsis: Aunty McRose Elu has been watching her ancestral lands slowly disappear beneath her feet for decades. The Saibai elder fears rising sea levels and increasingly severe weather events could mean her homeland is uninhabitable within 30 years.

title.children: 'Leave their bones behind': Elders fear losing gravesites in Torres Strait as climate change court fight continues

image.altText: Three children, a mother and a child walking together

items.synopsis: Everyone on Jessica's side of her family has been diagnosed with Huntington's disease. She is watching her mother slowly die, and has the condition herself.

title.children: 'I'm watching her die slowly': What it's like having the rare genetic condition Huntington's disease

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith looks at the camera outside a court building

items.synopsis: Last week's abridged version of Justice Anthony Besanko's judgement is set to be fleshed out when his full reasons are published today.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith will find out today how judge reached decision in defamation trial

image.altText: a huge crocodile in a small pond

items.synopsis: The giant animal's birthday will be celebrated at its home on Green Island in the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Cassius is the largest saltwater crocodile in captivity in the world. He might also be one of the oldest on Earth

image.altText: A woman with cropped hair wearing a merlot-coloured blazer sits in a chair in an offic.

items.synopsis: With productivity falling in Australia and AI developments advancing, could the technology be the answer to boosting output, or will it cause more job losses?

title.children: AI is being rolled out in workplaces around the country. Could it lead to widespread job losses?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiles as he sits on a stage with a blue background

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he wants Vietnam to become one of Australia's "top-tier" partners as he wraps up a two-day visit to Hanoi after signing a raft of agreements, including a package to help Vietnam decarbonise its economy.

title.children: Australia and Vietnam sign $105m decarbonisation agreement in Hanoi

image.altText: A close-up of a man aboard the Sundance Sail Darwin catamaran.

items.synopsis: This was supposed to be the year tourism across the Northern Territory bounced back, but weeks into what should be the peak of the season, David Woodrow is cutting his Darwin Harbour sunset cruises.

title.children: It's nearing the peak of the tourist season in the Top End, so why have visitor numbers dwindled?

image.altText: A lizard looking straight at the camera up and close

items.synopsis: A rise in the illegal trade of exotic Australian animals has made a remote Queensland outpost an unlikely front line in the fight against international smugglers.

title.children: Outback lizards on hit list for international animal traffickers

image.altText: Gary leans over Monic who is sitting in a hospital chair holding their baby

items.synopsis: Amid a cost-of-living crisis, international students in Australia will soon be forced to cut their working hours as previous rules put on hold to address labour shortages are reintroduced.

title.children: International students given grace period on working hours argue for the change to stay

image.altText: A worker welds as he installs bore-pile devices at a steel fabrication of rebar cages .

items.synopsis: New research finds China has surrendered its position as the largest single provider of development finance in South-East Asia in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.children: China overtaken as largest provider of development money in South-East Asia

image.altText: a building with Selwyn Snow Resort written on it and it's covered in snow

items.synopsis: Businesses in the Snowy Mountains are celebrating the return of Selwyn Snow Resort, reopening its doors next weekend for the first time since the Black Summer bushfires.

title.children: Three years after it burned down during the Black Summer bushfires Kosciuszko ski resort reopens

image.altText: Passengers gather around a bus, flipped on its side, in a ditch, after a crash at night off a highway.

items.synopsis: An Australian woman who was involved in a bus crash in Italy which reportedly claimed one life, says the company that owned the vehicle offered passengers a meal voucher "for the inconvenience".

title.children: Australian involved in fatal Italian bus crash says company offered $16 meal voucher

image.altText: King penguins swimming underwater.

items.synopsis: Australia's federal environment minister has signed off on plans to almost triple the size of the marine park off Macquarie Island.

title.children: Macquarie Island marine park set to almost triple in size

image.altText: Rescuers rest in the shade of a passenger train that derailed

items.synopsis: Officials say the derailment in eastern India that killed 275 people and injured hundreds was caused by an error in the electronic signalling system that led a train to wrongly change tracks and crash into a freight train.

title.children: Error in signalling system led to India's deadly train crash, official says

image.altText: Alexei Navalny looks stoic, with supporters with flags behind him

items.synopsis: Police in Russia have arrested more than 100 people who had taken to the streets to mark the 47th birthday of jailed Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny, a protest-monitoring group says.

title.children: Supporters of Russian opposition leader arrested during demonstrations

image.altText: an image of a koala with a joey

items.synopsis: Thermal drones discover 42 koalas at Coolah Tops when the previous government only had five documented sightings in the area over the past 70 years.

title.children: Minns government criticises Coalition's koala count as new colony found in NSW

image.altText: Li Shangfu salutes before delivering a speech at the Shangri-La Dialogue in Singapore

items.synopsis: China's Minister of National Defence General Li Shangfu tells Asia's top security summit that his country seeks dialogue over confrontation with the US, despite refusing American demands for military-to-military talks.

title.children: Chinese defence minister says clash with US would be 'unbearable disaster' for the world

image.altText: A middle aged woman with dark hair and glasses on head talks into a mic

items.synopsis: Senior officials from about two dozen of the world's major intelligence agencies, including Australia, hold a closed-door meeting on the fringes of the Shangri-La Dialogue security conference.

title.children: World's spy chiefs meet in secret conclave in Singapore

image.altText: A group of young Israeli soldiers, four women and a man, stand on a rocky road comforting each other.

items.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the killing of three soldiers by a member of the Egyptian security services is a terrorist attack and is demanding an "exhaustive and thorough" investigation.

title.children: Israel demands Egypt's help in full probe of 'tragic terrorist attack' at border

image.altText: A dark blue F1 car is just ahead of a red F1 car through a corner on a race track.

items.synopsis: Starting from pole, Red Bull's double world champion never looks threatened as he comfortably wins ahead of Mercedes pair Lewis Hamilton and George Russell.

title.children: Max Verstappen dominates Formula 1 Spanish Grand Prix, Oscar Piastri falls out of points

image.altText: Queensland Firebirds players smile and hug each other

items.synopsis: The NSW Swifts rise to the top of the standings, seeing off a third-quarter challenge to defeat the Giants 68-63 at a sold-out Ken Rosewall Arena.

title.children: Firebirds' Indigenous stars shine in boilover victory, Swifts top Super Netball ladder

image.altText: House on fire in the early morning, after shelling which has damaged buildings in a village.

items.synopsis: Shelling in Russia's Belgorod region has continued after two people were killed on Saturday and hundreds of children were evacuated, according to the region's governor.

title.children: Russian children evacuated as 'quite relentless' shelling continues to hit Belgorod
